About Me

The names Waseem Suleman and currently I work as a Technical Analyst in the Healthcare IT industry currently working for Cerner Corporation (more about this role below).

Work keeps me very busy however somehow I still manage to find time to freelance. I have a keen interest in developing Games, Web applications, Android applications and Operating systems.

Outside of computers my other passion is in design. I feel design is the essense of problem solving in the real world, whether this be website design or a shirt design. One of the aims of my blog portion of this website is to showcase some of my art pieces/designs.

At heart I am an entrepreneur and eager to get involved in projects; if you feel you have a project I may be interested in, feel free to contact me.

Working at Cerner!

Cerner is a leading IT Healthcare provider. Currently I work as a Technial Analyst as part of the Application Managed Services team; my two main responsibilities are Millennium Solution building and issue response. I work with trusts in developing and building Cerner Millennium tools to fit their needs. Cerner Millennium is Cerners leading 3 tier HNA solution. Areas of Millennium which I have knowledge on are FirstNet, CDS and Powerforms however work remains varried and this list is growing. From a technical perspective tasks can range from Oracle database management, ITIL standard troubleshooting and programming using Sax-Basic and Cerner CCL.

Educational background
University of Nottingham: MSci Computer Science

Grade: (2:1) which in GPA can be anywhere from 3.4 - 4.3 depending on who you ask.

No, that is not a typo or mistake, I completed the MSci degree at University of Nottingham. For those that dont know MSci is a fairly recent degree offered by a number of English Universities where the related Master and Bachelor courses are integrated to make a single 4 year course. In reality this just breaks down to doing the traditional 3 years of the BSc and then followed by the usual extra one year for the MSc.

University Projects

My final year thesis project: I developed a Shogi (Japanese Chess) board game using Haskell for which I received a first class grade (Distinction). Technologies used: GHC, Glade and GTK2HS.

Second year group software engineering project: Led a team to develop a large scale content based image searching algorithm. Technologies used were SQLite, Java, Swing and the Flickr API. Someday I may blog about the algorithm employed.

Other projects involved implementing a book sharing Android app using a client/server pattern, a POP3 email server and client using SQLite and a website using PHP, HTML and MySQL server amongst many others.

BTEC National Diploma in IT (Software Development)

Grade: Distinction Distinction Merit

A two year course equivelent to 3 A-Levels. Programming language the course was taught in was C# using the .net framework.
